item.title: Report E-2025030174
item.description:
Report E-2025030174

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-23T01:09:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-16
  • City: STEWARTVILLE
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 15000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Clean Harbors was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractorâ€™s arrival, personnel observed the top of one (1) 330-gallon IBC plastic tote was damaged and approximately twenty (20) ounces of material released impacting the trailer floor. Clean Harbors personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and placed the spent absorbents into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum. The remaining product was transferred into a new 330-gallon poly tote and shipped onto the consignee. The generated waste was staged onsite for the Dayton Freight Lines team to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report X-2025030923
item.description:
Report X-2025030923

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-22T21:13:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-13
  • City: MAPLE GROVE
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: X-2025030923 -HAZMAT CLERK NOTICED AN ODOR COMING FROM THIS PACKAGE WHILE IT SAT ON THE 8 WAY IRREG UNLOAD. IT HAD MINOR LIQUID LEAKS INTERNALLY, NO LIQUID LEAKED BEYOND THE EXTERNAL PACKAGING. X-2025030924-HAZMAT AUDITOR BROUTH THEIR TAM OVER AND SAID ONE OF THE HAZMATS ON THEIR TRAM HAD A STRONG ODOR COMMING FROM IT. INSPECTING THE HAZMAT IT HAD BOTH CLASS 5.1 AND 8 DIAMOND HAZARD LABELS AND INSIDE WERE 4 1GAL CONTAINERS WITH VENTED CAPS. ONE OF THE CAPS HAD BEN SCREWED ON CROOKED WHICH ALLOWED THE INNER CONTENTS TO LEAK OUT.
